title: Farmers allowed to act against monkeys, says environmentalist
byline: While pointing out that the toque monkey is one of five mammals in Sri Lanka not protected under the law, veteran environmentalist Dr. Jagath Gunawardane said farmers are allowed to take action against non-protected animals that trespass on their lands.

title: Heavy showers likely in Northern Province today
byline: The low-pressure area over the southwest Bay of Bengal is likely to continue moving west-northwestward slowly, towards the Tamil Nadu coast near Northern Sri Lanka, within the next 24 hours, the Meteorological Department said.

title: S Korea’s President Yoon vows to ’fight to the end’
byline: Embattled South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol has defended his shock decision to declare martial law last week, saying he did it to protect the country’s democracy.

title: WhatsApp and Instagram restored after Meta outages
byline: Instagram and WhatsApp are now back online after a mass global outage affected several Meta-owned apps on Wednesday.

title: Ambewela Farms achieves record-breaking daily milk production of 60,000 litres
byline: Lanka Milk Foods (CWE) PLC (LMF) has set an extraordinary benchmark at its Ambewela Farms, achieving a record-breaking daily milk production of 62,000 litres from a single source.

title: CSE’s ASPI surges to record high, exceeds 14,000 mark
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange’s All Share Price Index (ASPI) reached a historic milestone today, surpassing the 14,000 mark.

title: SJB finalises National List nominees
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) finalised its nominees for the remaining national list slots today.

title: UAE extends official invitation to President for visit
byline: The Ambassador to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) Khaled Nasser Al Ameri extended an official invitation to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake to visit the UAE as a gesture of goodwill, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: SIU investigates into Army personnel’s alleged role in police injuries
byline: The Special Investigation Unit (SIU) of the Sri Lanka Police has launched an inquiry into reports alleging that an Army Intelligence officer was responsible for the injuries sustained by police officers during a protest outside the Isurupaya building in Battaramulla.

title: Man arrested with Rs 4.5 mn worth foreign cigarettes
byline: A 57-year-old man was arrested early this morning, while attempting to smuggle in foreign manufactured cigarettes worth approximately Rs. 4.5 million at the Bandaranaike International Airport Arrival Terminal.

title: Enjoining order issued preventing SJB from sending National List to EC
byline: The Colombo District Court issued an enjoining order preventing the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) from sending its list of nominations for the SJB National List to the Election Commission without including the name of Sri Lanka Muslim Congress (SLMC) Secretary Nizam Kariapper.

title: Fever outbreak in Jaffna identified as Leptospirosis
byline: The fever that spread in Jaffna, claiming seven lives, has been identified as Leptospirosis, commonly known as Rat Fever, the Epidemiology Unit of the Health Ministry announced today.

title: Two sisters killed in expressway accident
byline: Two sisters were killed after the car they were travelling in collided with a lorry on the Southern Expressway.

title: Supreme Court clears obstacles to judicial appointments
byline: A Fundamental Rights petition filed by a lawyer seeking an order directing the Constitutional Council to approve the recommendation made by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe to appoint the incumbent President of the Court of Appeal, Nissanka Bandula Karunaratne, as a Supreme Court judge was dismissed with costs today by the Supreme Court.

title: Formulate policies, make decisions in the best interest of schoolchildren: PM
byline: Policies should be formulated, and decisions should be made based on data that prioritises the best interests of schoolchildren. Officials should also treat the public humanely, recognising their role as providers of public services, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Adani Ports pulls out of US funding for CWIT
byline: Adani Ports noted that the project, which is a joint venture with John Keells Holdings (JKH) and the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA), would be financed through the company’s internal accruals and capital management plan.

title: Geminids meteor shower visible in Sri Lanka on Dec 14
byline: The Geminids Meteor shower will be visibe to Sri Lanka at its peak on December 14, the Arthur C. Clarke Centre said.

title: Biden commutes nearly 1,500 sentences, pardons 39 people
byline: United States President Joe Biden has commuted nearly 1,500 prison sentences and pardoned 39 people in what the White House has described as the largest act of clemency in a single day in the country’s modern history.

title: Sri Lanka receives Beechcraft from Australia to strengthen air operations
byline: The addition of the modern twin-engine turboprop aircraft to the Sri Lanka Air Force will play a crucial role in strengthening Sri Lanka’s efforts to combat maritime threats, including drug trafficking and human smuggling, while also supporting disaster relief in the country and search operations in the Indian Ocean.

title: SC rules Sarath Weerasekara, CID violated Azath Salley’s Fundamental Rights
byline: The Supreme Court today declared that the fundamental rights of former Governor of the Western Province Azath Salley had been violated by former Minister of Public Security Sarath Weerasekara and two CID officers through his arrest and detention in 2021.

title: SLPP invites Govt, Opposition MPs to support no-confidence motion on Speaker
byline: In the wake of growing allegations over Speaker Ashoka Sapumal Ranwala’s academic qualifications, the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has invited all Opposition and Government MPs to support the no-confidence motion on the Speaker.

title: President calls for strengthening financial system
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has directed the Ministry of Finance to implement measures to enhance the efficiency and resilience of Sri Lanka’s financial system.
